bill_title: require certain lessors of residential property to disclose that the lessor or any person employed at the residential property is a registered sex offender.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain lessors of residential property to disclose that the lessor or any person employed at the residential property is a registered sex offender. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 43-32 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: In any hiring of a residential premises, any lessor who is required to register as a sex offender pursuant to § § 22-24B-1 to 22-24B-14, inclusive, shall disclose that information to any lessee or any person who may become a lessee. If the lessor employs any person at the residential premises who is required to register as a sex offender pursuant to § § 22-24B-1 to 22- 24B-14, inclusive, the lessor shall disclose that information to any lessee or any person who may become a lessee. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
